block.p: JOSE EBER, hairdresser to the stars (Elizabeth Taylor, Cher, Victoria Principal) sports a pretty impressive mane of his own and, now, a new 10,000-square-foot-salon at 2 Rodeo Drive in Beverly Hills.

"In the 30's and 40's, beauty salons used to have comfort, and women used to be pampered," Mr. Eber said. "But we lost it in the 80's when we had to fill up every chair and get the most of the square footage."
JOSE EBER, hairdresser to the stars (Elizabeth Taylor, Cher, Victoria Principal) sports a pretty impressive mane of his own and, now, a new 10,000-square-foot-salon at 2 Rodeo Drive in Beverly Hills.

"In the 30's and 40's, beauty salons used to have comfort, and women used to be pampered," Mr. Eber said. "But we lost it in the 80's when we had to fill up every chair and get the most of the square footage."
Illuminated by a skylight, a terrazzo and marble staircase spirals from the ground floor, a 1,000-square-foot boutique, to the 9,000-square-foot second-floor salon.

The walls are mostly white. Floors are terrazzo inlaid with yellow or green marble leaves. "The materials have to look rich, but also be very durable," said Gary Gilbar, an architect who, with Remy Jousserin, an interior designer, created the salon.
Chairs, designed by Philippe Starck, have cast-iron frames and blush-pink seats. For the reclusive celebrity, a V.I.P. lounge has a single station, banquette, television and refrigerator.
